quotes.quote: I have always loved Waffle House. It's been like an oasis in the desert many times late at night after one of my concerts.
Waffles are like pancakes with syrup traps.
You should eat a waffle! You can’t be sad if you eat a waffle!
I don’t know about you, but I must fill every waffle square with syrup.
Life is too short to wonder where you hid your waffle maker.
Even for the most excitable preacher, there was nothing inherently sinful about a waffle.

There's something about waffle geometry and the transformative power of the waffle iron that turns a recipe into an adventure, and if there's one thing that's become clear to me, it's that I'm not the only one who finds the adventure irresistible.
Whether it's good old fashioned buttermilk waffles doused in maple syrup, down-home manwich sloppy joes, or chocolate covered waffle pops, waffles are a carb lover's dream come true.
Waffle people, on the other hand — of which i am one — are off kilter, willy-nilly, moody, irascible, easily distracted, and subject to experiencing peaks and valleys like those that define a waffle.
A taste so profound and complex that it can't even be compared to other tastes, only to emotions. Cheesy waffles, I was thinking, tastes like love without the fear of love's dissolution.
That's usually how they start, the young ones. Meaningless waffle.
My thoughts are like waffles the first few don't look so good.
There's nothing sadder than a sobbing waffle.
